headline: PNC Financial names former BlackRock executive as president
summary: PNC Financial Services Group on Monday appointed former BlackRock executive Mark Wiedman as president, effective immediately. Wiedman will also assume presidency of the Pittsburgh-based company's wholly owned banking subsidiary, PNC Bank, PNC Financial said. Wiedman will report to Chief Executive William Demchak.

headline: BlackRock Chief Larry Fink Says CEOs See the Economy in Recession Already
summary: His remarks join a chorus of warnings and dim views on the economy from financial leaders and economists.

headline: BlackRock CEO says stocks could extend fall by 20%, economy probably in recession
summary: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink on Monday said stock markets could extend their decline by 20% as the U.S. imposes steep tariffs, noting the economy is probably already in a recession. Speaking at the Economic Club of New York, Fink expressed worry that there is much more inflationary pressure than the market expects. But the leader of the world's largest asset manager said the recent market declines are "more of a buying opportunity than a selling opportunity," in the long run, and did not pose systemic risks.

headline: BlackRock's Fink Won't Rule Out Another 20% Market Decline
summary: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink says he sees the recent selloff in US equities as a buying opportunity during an interview with Erik Schatzker at The Economic Club of New York.

headline: Copper’s Bull Run Turns to Rout as Reality of Tariffs Bites
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Two weeks ago, copper prices were surging as traders warned that threatened US tariffs on the metal would squeeze global supplies. Now, bulls are confronting one of the market’s worst-ever selloffs as President Donald Trump’s broader trade war upends the outlook for demand.Most Read from BloombergHousing Agency Aims to Relocate Its DC HeadquartersBoston Mayor Wu Embraces Trump Resistance as Campaign Heats UpThis Skinny Mexico City Tower Is Just 14 Feet Wide on One SideThe Irish Ho
